Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant - does what it says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: NedK74
Reviews.Content: There are mixed reviews for this hotel. I found the front desk staff to be very helpful and friendly. I was not expecting the Ritz, but I was pleasantly surprised with the little extras they had. Was funny though to see to save on carpeting, it was bare concrete underneath the bed! LOL! That said, the very large bed was extremely comfortable. No, the towels are not the best - not bath sheet or towel size, but I had seen the warnings on this, so had bought my own, but they served the purpose if needed. Modern facilities and great to have a fridge and microwave in the room as well as a large flat screen TV. For the budget conscious who would like the unexpected treat, I would recommend, though not if wanting to be closer to downtown - though it's not too long a walk to the Metro at Joyce, so all was good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorontoBobo
Reviews.Content: Easier access than I thought, my girlfriend and I came from Metrotown and Sushi Garden for dinner and then we have decided to rest for my weekend. I can't see how bad this hotel can be, of course they are not a five-star hotel, but I can say that their service are above standard and from my experience, the price was worth it! Definitely coming back for my x'mas trip.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: StrawberryMochi
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasant stay at the hotel, close to train to DT area as well as the metrotown shopping center to spend time with my bf. I say its a great and cheap place for young travellers. The breakfast was so-so, but we explore the neighbourhood and there were restaurants everywhere! Very nice staff during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “ACK!”
Reviews.Author: TacomaStrawberry
Reviews.Content: Dirty carpet everywhere, room, halls. Mold in shower stall & curtain. Had the old bldg. smell goin' on. Don't waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated but clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PortsmouthChris
Reviews.Content: We would agree about the musty smell but on the whole we were quite satisfied. We had 2 rooms for my husband and me and our friend, both with a view of the mountains but there were also big electricity pylons outside the windows so we were glad there wasn't a storm! A light didn't work in both rooms which we reported. One was fixed that day, but not the other. We thought the hotel was good value and quite convenient for the skytrain which took us straight into town. The aircon was efficient if a little noisy on high. There was a complimentary breakfast supplied, but the dining room was being renovated so we had to have it in the lobby and the first morning all the pastries had gone even though we were well within the serving time. Staff were very apologetic and provided granola bars! We considered these minor niggles and would stay there again if we were in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Zoegan
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks nice from outside, the room was decent and clean. We got upgraded to one that got a view of the mountain side which was really nice. The front desk staff are REALLY nice and helpful! I love that I got free internet, which is great! My main beef with the place...it does have a dank, musky smell. Even though the hotel is smoke free, I suspect that it's previous owners did not prevent that...and since it looks like the carpet and wall paper wasn't changed...the smell is stuck. And the aircon works well, only problem is the knob doesn't necessarily point to the correct direction. Ha! That took some experimenting to figure out.

Reviews.Title: “Was acceptable until they ripped us off - will not be back”
Reviews.Author: aleanef
Reviews.Content: After reading review for this hotel i was ready to accept the message of 'you get what you pay for' at this hotel. Well we sure were paying for more than we got, the room was acceptable with enough room for me and my friends but there was only one towel in the bathroom and only one keycard for the three of us. We requested more of both and only got one more of each. The whole three days we spent there the pool was not open for some unknown reason we didn't explore (we had better things to do). Underground parking was cramped and smelled of urine. The only person who worked there was nice to was the lady we checked in with, other than that service was abysmal and upon checkout we were informed that the maid cleaned up our 'extra mess' so we had to pay 26$ extra. There was no extra mess - we will not be coming back here.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Happyharry34
Reviews.Content: Smells damp upon arrival but that is the pool in the basement. Rooms clean and functional. Good cheap asian restaurants nearby, ask the staff. Mid town but 7 minute walk to train and short train journey on V efficient public transport to centre. Free WiFi all over and computer in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “i found our stay at the cassandra hotel very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: josanda3
Reviews.Content: nice area, I found our stay at the cassandra hotel very pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicksud
Reviews.Content: Starting our Vancouver trip, we browsed through countless lists of hotels. With big hotel names like Ramada, Hilton and many other showing up. We tried to find a hotel that had a reasonable location, accommodation, and price. Something that wasn't too cheap or too expensive, yet still was pretty good.  Cassandra Hotel stood out from the rest. Not only is the location quite prime being in the Kingsway Area (which is pretty close to central/downtown Vancouver) it is also quite close to Metrotown, which is excellent for shopping. The only downside to the location is that it's quite hard to get anywhere to and from the hotel without having a car. The overall accommodation is great as the hotel is really clean and comfortable. It might not be as luxurious as other hotels, yet it had a warm and friendly environment. With the receptionist greeting us in and out of the hotel at all times. One receptionist (named Jenny) was especially helpful and informative regarding the hotel facilities. This really impressed us at how well trained and personal the staff is at this hotel.  A definite plus of the hotel is the complimentary breakfast of a muffin, juice, and croissant. Although it wasn't much, it made us feel appreciated and it also tasted good as well. For the price, Cassandra Hotel has a excellent wifi service. With about 3 wifi locations inside the hotel so that it's really easy to get a high signal strength. The rooms really impressed us the most. They have a quite large space for the room and the clean bed sheets changed everyday. We also liked the room's simple yet elegant minimalist design while still including useful amenities (like the microwave/coffee maker). The only downside to the rooms are the beds that slopes inside and the fairly loud fan. All in all for about C$70- C$110 a night (depends on the day and rooms available), this has been one of the more memorable stays we had in Canada. With a fairly good location, room, and value, we will definitely stay at this hotel the next time we go to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice.......”
Reviews.Author: GBGodfrey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overrated. For about $100 a night, they either need to drop their rates, or shut down and renovate. Don't be deceived by the photos on the internet, as MAJOR renovation is greatly needed. For example, the Continental breakfast consists of asking the desk clerk for juice in a box, coffee made by a non-coffee drinker, and a hard croissant/biscuit. The fitness facilities consisted of 3 pieces of equipment that were almost on top of each other; an unpleasant odor that is not conducive to working out; and a sauna/whirlpool room that was literally in a dungeon environment, making you feel rather creepy. In addition, the rooms are a good size, but there were no washcloths, bedspread, fitted bottom sheets on the bed, and mildew on the tiles of the tub/shower. However, the biggest plus was we could get WiFi in our room, and the desk clerks were very helpful. Not being a very picky person, I don't think I would ever stay there again as long as it remains in the same deteriorating condition.

Reviews.Title: “Why is this hotel rated 9 out of 10?”
Reviews.Author: Nathanie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 2 years ago and thought it was OK (probably because I had been staying 2 stars hotel then and now I have been staying 3 stars hotels, and that's why I have to write this review :)) For some reason we have to stay in Vancouver today expecting ok = normal 3 stars hotel. When we see the hotel today, I was surprised why I thought the hotel was actually "OK". The elevator is super worn and torn. The ceiling was broken, and the water was dripping right outside the first room we stayed and the room smell weird. When I re-checked if I booked the right hotel on xxxxx.com again, I saw brilliant pictures of the hotel, looked like a 3.5 stars+ (that's why photographer got high paid). But the reality looks nothing like what it is on the pictures. So I immediately called the front desk and the very helpful and friendly staff was willing to upgrade me to the "contemporary" room from the "classic" room with no charge. The new room is not that much different, but at least they have seemingly cleaner carpet. I'm not sure if I have different feeling from 2 years ago is because I have been staying in 3 stars hotels recently, but no matter what, this hotel should in no way be getting 9 out of 10 rating, right?

Reviews.Title: “I loved it & I am coming back to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MikeBISL
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay. Location is great. The front desk was very friendly & helpful. Especially Nicky & Jenny. They help us find the best place to visit in the city. They even took the time to get my girlfriend a little something for her birthday. We`re definitely coming back to stay here. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and I like its location”
Reviews.Author: Cooart
Reviews.Content: I m not sure why there were so many bad reviews earlier for this hotel but I like it. I m not expecting to stay in a 5 star hotel by paying less than $100 for a night in summer. Our room got nice mountain view. We went for some restaurants close to this hotel. There r many options. Overall impression is not that bad. We like Vancouver and we will definitely come to Vancouver again next year!

Reviews.Title: “most uncomfortable hotel bed EVER”
Reviews.Author: CBinSeattle
Reviews.Content: This place has an attractive list of amenities and nice-looking photos, and so when we saw how cheap it was, we thought it must be due to the neighborhood it's in. Well, the neighborhood is indeed not a good one, but I would say that given how crappy the hotel actually was, we should have been paying even less than we did. Yes, they do have some nice amenities (microwave and WiFi, etc.), but they get their money back by doing things like not carpeting under your bed (it was just bare concrete), stowing junk in the parking area, using IKEA lamps as the only nod to modern decor, not re-caulking over the moldy grout in the shower, and not bothering to air out the rooms. And the mattress and pillow really were *incredibly* uncomfortable--saggy, lumpy, you name it. I'm not a person with high expectations in the mattress/pillow department, but having to pay for that level of discomfort was insulting.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here!”
Reviews.Author: RHochreuter
Reviews.Content: I travel alot and i've been in many hotels and motels in Canada and in USA for the past couple of years. But this hotel is one of the worst i've been in. The staff is not very friendly - we had some few very simple questions and the staff in the front desk looked very unhappy and was rather rude in my oppionion. As we went to the room - the overall impression was that it was VERY dirty. The floors very dirty - you could feel your feet stick to the tiles on the ground for every step you made. As we came to the second floor all the ceilings in the hallways was missing - I did some searching on the internet - and i've found out that they had a water damage over A YEAR AGO. Well besides from the very unclean hotel - there was a very bad smell in all the hotel - in the room, in the lobby, in the hallways even in the parking lot. We are only staying here for 2 days - and we have slept here for 1 day now. We have been thinking about changing hotel over and over again already.. THE GOOD PARTS: Free wireless internet - which actually works. Safe parking below the hotel (very dirty though).

Reviews.Title: “Not the absolute worst but wouldn't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: taraship
Reviews.Content: It's a cheap hotel. I got what I paid for...in an eclectic neighborhood but very, very far from anywhere you would want to be in Vancouver. However, the front desk was great and gave fantastic directions for public transportation each morning I was there. No complaints about the front desk at all. Apparently, they couldn't afford to carpet the entire room because under each of the beds was just a dirty, unfinished concrete floor with strips of carpet on either side. I was hesitant to walk in the room barefoot. It didn't look dirty, I just felt like it was. Towels were threadbare and rough. They also had signs around the building with directions on garbage disposal for weekly guests. I don't particularly want to stay at cheap hotels that also rent by the week so that might have contributed to my feelings re: the place. It's kind of a dirty, worn hotel. I didn't feel unsafe and it was fairly quiet but not for my taste. Maybe on step above a hostel but only because I got my own room and bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Please do yourself a favor”
Reviews.Author: cambur
Reviews.Content: Do not believe in any single of the EXCELLENT reviews. This hotel is the worst hotel I have ever been in North America. I do extensive travel around the Continent, and not even in the poorest country in South America you find such a poor maintained motel. You are coming to the famous Vancouver so please dont tint that experience by staying in that piece of yunk. Ohhh, why I ended up there???? thanks to my money saver office manager

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great price”
Reviews.Author: Angelaagnew
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice with a really great price. the location is also perfect. Strongly recommend to those friends with limit budget.

Reviews.Title: “Probably not”
Reviews.Author: twocatsSeattle
Reviews.Content: Apparently photos can be very disceiving. From the outside throughout is an aging Inn with a few attempts to update on the inside but the wear and tear is showing. (popcorn ceiling, shower faucets that cannot quite close, awful hall carpet, plastic flowers in room, etc.) The heater did not work in the room at all but blew cold air - it was freezing in the room. When we complained the staff brought a space heater that solved the problem but clearly they have it for just such a reason. There was a cobweb in the ceiling and there were two small towels and handtowels (no washclothes) and the handtowels both had oil stains that had been bleached but were still present. The staff as reviews said were very friendly and helpful. However, from reviews on their site I expected a much better experience. I would put this as a clean low grade hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, Friendly staff, Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Makio_1980
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to Metrotown, a huge shopping malls. The atmosphere is very cozy and chic. The front desk service is helpful and staff is extremely accommodating. The room I stayed was a lot larger than I expected. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Large room and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Marymacana
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with trendy and comfortable room. Definitely qualified for higher star. Room has north shore mountain view. Duvet beddings r pretty comfortable. I will definitely come back again. Much better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Convenient and definitley No Frills”
Reviews.Author: mukuma
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this hotel before I travelled and they were'nt that good but still booked as it was the cheapest hotel I found for a solo traveller. Good points I suppose is the location. It is a 10 minute walk to Joyce Sky train. The 19 bus which goes all the way to downtown and stanley Park stops just outside the hotel. There is a Safeway just 10 minutes up the road and a good Indian Restaurant that I tried a couple times. The area does feel safe. The staff are friendly. The room was basic and clean. Bad points are, the front office carpet does smell and needs a good clean. The rate includes breakfast which I never had once. Apparently you are supposed to ask for it at the front desk , pick up a pastry and a coffee on your way out ! I kept on forgetting ! I would recomment this hotel for solo travellers on a tight budget .

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel for Young Gen”
Reviews.Author: c_ctravel_world
Reviews.Content: I have pretty good impression of my stay in this small but cute hotel. Location is perfect for a shopaholic like me. So close to Metrotown and close to Downtown as well. I almost went shopping every day with my friend since its convenience. I will definitely be back next time. Hotel staff are really cool and pretty. They are so helpful on providing personal advice on the restaurants to go, events to go in Vancouver. I also get the best discount from booking from their facebook. Their staff used Ipad and ipod touch to show me different info I need. I guess no any hotel has such techy staff like this hotel does. The tech is almost everywhere. However, if it can be applied into their rooms, will be cooler.

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever!”
Reviews.Author: kellymu
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Cassandra Hotel and it was the dirtiest hotel we have ever stayed in.Tthe price for the pet was $50 canadian for a dog over 20lbs. which for the quality was over the top. We would not recommend this hotel to any traveler, I would say stay at a little more expensive place for the cleanliness and make it a better experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, large rooms, great staff but I won't be returning.”
Reviews.Author: lulubelle45
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel before checking the reviews so I was alittle worried. I had also got the best rate with a no cancellation no refund policy. I had read afterwards that it was full of bedbugs and shady guests, but after paying $126 that would not be returned, i hoped for the best. I did NOT have any issues with those, but i left there feeling like I was the problem, as they ask for a deposit of $150 as well as the payment for the room upfront. We checked in after 2pm as they charge you if you're earlier, and found a really nice clean room, however for the 4 of us, there were only 2 large towels and 2 hand towels. no facecloths, so we had to ask the front desk for more. There is absolutely no info in the room regarding the hotel ammenities, nearby restaurants, etc. You have to go down to the lobby. They charge extra for internet access. They only gave us one card key, which took at least 7 swipes to open any doors. The secure underground parking was tight with our truck, and in order to leave, you have to drive forward and back a few times over the cord to activate the door. In order to use the sauna and hot tub, you have to get a key from the front desk. They only had 3 keys, so we had to get let in by the front staff as all the keys were signed out at the time. The hot tub facilities were fine, clean and has a shower etc. You have to uncover/cover the water but thats no big deal. We had a wonderful sleep, the beds were very comfortable and no bedbugs. It wasn't until check out that i had finally had enough with the rules. I went to the front desk to return the key, and the staff member promptly left to check the room out to see what condition I had left it in. Upon his return, he stated everything was fine and they would release my $150 deposit on the room between 2 to 5 business days!!! Except for my receipt for the credit card i used, there is nothing written anywhere that I even made a deposit much less the fact that they hold it for up to 5 days!!! Made me feel like a shady guest!!! I had to ask him to sign my room receipt with that detail to cover my butt. Its a shame really that they treat their guests this way in light of all the poor comments associated with this hotel. If they hope to improve they need to lighten up and learn some good PR and customer relations. I can afford to wait for my deposit but not everyone can, and as this was only 2 days ago, its not returned yet. I wouldn't reccommend this one, sorry

Reviews.Title: “Definitely improving”
Reviews.Author: amoundici
Reviews.Content: I've read the reviews and was really looking for a budget hotel. I took the dive and decided to stay 2 nights here with my hubby. I braced myself for the worst and was completely caught off guard. It's got a great location, near Metrodown and close to downtown. The staff was so pleasant, they treated us like newlyweds. We made it for breakfast and it was free. We reported our remote wasn't working but they fixed it. It wasn't in the best shape, with the pipe renovation and all, but it seems like they are renovating for something new. We're checking out today and are thinking of coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Value, you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: worldtravel2Florida
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive Hotel in an Asian part of the city. Bathroom was old but clean, bed was comfortable. Decent inexpensive restaurants within walking distance. Wifi available. This Hotel is a great value but do not expect anything more than the basics. Staff was very friendly, "continental breakfast" was mediocre at best.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: TbeanCourtenay
Reviews.Content: Last June my mother and I travelled to Vancouver to spend the weekend visiting with Family. We booked a room at the Cassandra online for the weekend. Once we arrived at the hotel we weren't even allowed to enter our room for hours as the lobby was holed up with armed police officers in regards to one of the tenants. I immediately asked for my money back as I did not feel safe staying there and was refused. Once in our room it was smelly and not very clean. I booked my room for 2 people and a pet, once there I was charged over a hundred dollars a night extra to keep my chihuahua there. Also after the first night we were asked to move rooms the second day, which we had to check out at 11 and not allowed in second room until after 2. The second room was not cleaned and smelled like urine, the windows did not open and we weren't allowed to smoke when we reserved a smoking room. All in all it cost more than five hundred dollars to stay for the 2 nights. It was a nightmare and I will never stay in that dump ever again. I wouldn't even rate this with any stars.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: bidderpais
Reviews.Content: PROS: - Cheap: Our room was priced under $70/night on Travelocity - Proximity to key locations: 20 minute drive to downtown. 20 minute drive to Surrey. - Public Transit: 10 minute walk to Joyce SkyTrain station, to go downtown or Surrey - Free Underground Parking - Spacious Room CONS: - Elevator & Hallway Smelled of smoke - Swipe card / key did not work on several occasions. During the 5 days we stayed there, we had to exchange our swipe card 4 times. - TV Remote was not working, and did not get fixed - Staff are unfriendly for most part - Wireless internet is not free; but available @ an hourly / daily rate

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cassandra, Vancouver, BC”
Reviews.Author: ctfirefly
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights Sept 08. The hotel is based near china town, about 8 stops from downtown Vancouver on the skytrain, the station of which is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. There is also a bus stop just next to the hotel. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was nice, but a bit stuffy due to the fact that the windows did not open. But once the AC kicked in it was okay. The only problem with the room other than the windows, was that there were cigarette burns on the bedspread and cobwebs on the ceiling but all in all the room was nice. I cannot comment on the hotel amenities i.e. spa, laundrette etc as we did not use them. I would recommend staying in this reasonably priced comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: ebbles
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel fabulous, lovely reception staff, clean room, great price, good facilties and only one 20 minute bus ride from down town. Definitely no complaints and it has earned it's stars what do people expect for spending under $100 if you want 5 star service go to a 5 star hotel otherwise this one is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay. Good value for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: travellinroy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip. The staff was helpful and friendly. I had a problem with my room's heater/aircon, but it got fixed fairly quickly. The room was a steal compared to other hotels that I was looking it. The Collingwood area was also nice too since there were a lot of ethnic restaurants that I got to eat at. Overall, good value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “It's pretty good.”
Reviews.Author: zhejiangyu
Reviews.Content: We lived in a Suite which has two bedrooms to fit our family. We are landed immigrants here and living in Cassandra hotel for 14 days to find a new place to live in the future. The place is not as bad as someone describes. My kids enjoy the whirlpool and sauna service there, and that's for free. The frontdesk staff can speak our language, we are really appreciated because we can know more information about how to get our sin card and they help us a lot. Thanks. We are new here, but they let us feel better in a totally new place. The room is pretty large enough for our 4 people, my wife, my two daughters and me. But the only thing is that they don't have a kitchen.We were planning to live here monthly, coz they have monthly rent which is much cheaper than paying daily; but we need a kitchen. Friendly and multi-language staffs make our stay very happy. So if you like us,a family,we suggest you living there. It's very conveient to eat around this hotel, like the new restaurant which is just opened, and you can also eat in the other different restaurants,we almost tried all of them when living there. Bino family restaurant provides breakfast all day.

Reviews.Title: “A real rip-off”
Reviews.Author: SoftwareGypsy
Reviews.Content: I was in Burnaby (Vancouver ) on business last week and all the local brand-name hotels were full due to the Under-20 World Cup Soccer event there, so I booked a room at Cassandra via the Internet. The room was clean-ish and didn't smell of smoke, but there was a cigarette burn on the bedspread, the soap was about as big as a 50-cent piece and only slightly thicker, the sheets were thin and limp (polyester?), the pillows were hard, the towels were small. I had to go down to the front desk and sign for a TV remote - I guess people steal them or something. And as others have noted here, they charged $5 a day for internet wi-fi. The desk clerk had trouble setting up an ID for me so I didn't get to use internet the first day but they charged me for it anyway. But the real rip-off came when I decided to check out a day early and go stay near the airport for the last night because a) I had a 7:00am flight the next day and b) I couldn't wait to get out of there. I notified them the night before that I would be leaving in the morning, and the clerk on duty said no problem. But the next morning the kid on the front desk charged me for the full 3 days. He said their cancellation policy required 48 hour notice and his manager would be angry if he gave me a "discount". But the manager was not there and the clerk refused to call him. I made the clerk print out a copy of the cancellation policy for me, and it turned out to be the standard "no show" policy where if you don't come at all and fail to notify them 48 hours in advance they can charge you for 1 night. It says nothing about leaving a day early after you have arrived. I am disputing the bill right now via American Express. My advice is DON'T STAY AT CASSANDRA!.

Reviews.Title: “creepy, but awesome”
Reviews.Author: BuddhaVic
Reviews.Content: The distinct smell of marijuana plagued the first floor and the property was bordered by multiple hookers on Kingsway. Despite the apparent cleanliness of the room, it did not make up for the lack of courtesy from the hotel staff--no one looked up when you walked in and they seemed annoyed by the simplest of questions. The rooms were big enough for four of us and could be satisfactory if there for a night or two. We stayed for an entire week and the longer we stayed, the more creepy it got. Besides the smell of ganga, a persistent garlic/onions aroma pervaded the second floor. About 25 minutes away from city center, but the area around Cassandra is pretty interesting in and of itself. An Indian movie theater, restaurants, Starbucks, and a Safeway are all in walking distance. If you go, check out the Jaguar's pub at the Ramada up the street...one word: CLASSY. They even have a Jam night on Sundays, definitely worth checking out. And if you find yourself on Marine Drive, look for the bun master, it's the best baked goods you'll ever eat. Overall, if you're with a family, avoid Cassandra. But if you're like me and my friends (a group of twenty-somethings looking for an interesting/cheap hotel) Cassandra is the way to go. If security and scent are issues for you, find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thang007
Reviews.Content: Apparently Vancouver has different standards than the rest of the world. The Cassandra Hotel reeked of smoke the moment I walked in and the rooms were no different. I booked this on Hotels[--] and couldn't get out quick enough and still got charged for the 3 nights I didn't stay there. Great all around experience. So if there ever was a scam this is it.

Reviews.Title: “not the best”
Reviews.Author: BAnnK
Reviews.Content: They hotel lobby didn't smell all that good. I thought people were smoking in there. The room wasn't too bad but the carpet was filthy and the halls smelled of smokers too. They had a laundry facility that worked well but the trash was overflowing and all over the floor and the price for washing and drying was $2.50 each. The room was not inexpensive, $115 and they charged $5 a day for Wifi connections. I would not stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Cassandra Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 3075 Kingsway, Vancouver, British Columbia V5R 5J8, Canada
